intro: Anthyllis vulneraria subsp. dertosensis, commonly known as the Dertos thornvetch, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of the Mediterranean. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and thorny stems. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its subspecies status highlights genetic and morphological distinctions from the broader Anthyllis vulneraria species.
